data.text:
Climate change lawsuits are on the rise around the world, drawing on existing laws that guarantee everyone the fundamental right to a healthy environment.

More from @UNEP on the essential role of courts in addressing the climate crisis: https://t.co/8wH5DKgnnY #ClimateAction https://t.co/ywb6nv6F44

In Syria, kids are back in class after months of school closures due to #COVID19. 

Watch as @WFP prepares & delivers fresh & healthy meals to students to help them stay nourished & focused on learning.  https://t.co/pxiDW66KCK https://t.co/ZCvsURdzN2

We must honour the past to safeguard the future.

Ahead of Wednesday's #HolocaustRemembranceDay, see how to #ProtectTheFacts and take a stand against Holocaust distortion.

https://t.co/uJ3Y1FoTkg via @UNESCO https://t.co/LnlhpVRuaM

Child labour has decreased by 38% since 2000 - yet, 152 million children worldwide are still trapped in child labour, according to @ILO.

2021 is the International Year to #EndChildLabour. https://t.co/69G4ArkMSc https://t.co/pLVM7CGNZZ

"A country’s ability to adapt to & prepare for the increasingly harmful impacts of the climate crisis should not depend on its wealth."

-- @antonioguterres at Monday's Climate Adaptation Summit. https://t.co/jXMPwpNS4I #ClimateAction https://t.co/zKerV8sj72

They were promised a week-long journey, but ended up suffering in inhumane conditions on a cramped boat for more than six months. 

Now, a group of Rohingya refugees recount their horrific journey. 

Read their story. via @Refugees https://t.co/Sj8jAi9Pl6

"We have a unique chance to change course and put the world on track. The opportunity to end the spiral of destruction is in our hands."

-- @antonioguterres says the world can recover better from #COVID19. https://t.co/W2xnjjOYuQ https://t.co/n3byw4keNi

"The pandemic was impossible to predict. Many of its consequences on peace & security are not."

-- UN political chief @DicarloRosemary tells Security Council that recovering better from #COVID19 must involve strengthened capacity for conflict prevention. https://t.co/VCDgHYUxCq

"Let us live up to our responsibilities and jointly change course towards a sustainable, fair and resilient future."

-- @antonioguterres calls for support for building resilience at Climate Adaptation Summit. https://t.co/jXMPwpNS4I #ClimateAction https://t.co/VW9bKf8dGc

Ali's life depends on farming, but when floods & desert locusts destroyed his crops, he faced devastation. 

See how @FAO  is helping Ali & other people in Somalia recover from this dual threat. https://t.co/aManRLnhNI https://t.co/ZJ5kp9UvTO

Cervical cancer can be prevented.

Getting vaccinated and regular screenings & treatment can help ensure cervical health. More from @WHO during January's cervical cancer awareness month: https://t.co/S7tbydj7hV https://t.co/DBn3qd7maZ

This week's Climate Adaptation Summit aims at accelerating, innovating & scaling up global efforts to adapt to the effects of the climate crises. https://t.co/yB6HCjNNIR #ClimateAction https://t.co/GIOKwsPpjQ

"The elimination of nuclear weapons remains the highest disarmament priority of the United Nations."

-- @antonioguterres as the Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons entered into force last week. https://t.co/0dXclsVTYT https://t.co/FbpZvFFvPg

Reproductive rights are human rights.

@UNFPA works to promote universal access to sexual & reproductive health & rights, including family planning. https://t.co/xdJ1fT08Hp #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/gHPwEYSrum

"As the world continues to battle the pandemic, education – as a fundamental right and a global public good – must be protected to avert a generational catastrophe."

-- @antonioguterres on Sunday's #EducationDay. https://t.co/brXCmCptZk https://t.co/MpDscQFnIb

Companies who are part of the solution will be rewarded.

-- UN Envoy Mark Carney explains how the #RaceToZero carbon emissions is putting pressure on businesses to take more #ClimateAction. https://t.co/e3piymQHLj https://t.co/5LblRPvYnT
✏️ Happy #EducationDay 📔 to all students, teachers, parents & other heroes around the world who are ensuring learning doesn't stop despite #COVID19. https://t.co/aCNXDBfjRV https://t.co/oESmQAH2iy

Use your creativity to celebrate action for gender equality! 🎨

Join @UN_Women's comic and cartoon competition & show your support for #GenerationEquality! https://t.co/zaGsgvEHnv https://t.co/6PvLJRwipu

The #COVID19 crisis caused the largest ever learning disruption, affecting 1.6 billion students worldwide. 

We need to step up collaboration & global solidarity to place education at the centre of the pandemic recovery. https://t.co/gMDcwZROj2 #EducationDay https://t.co/DsYZkTR2VZ

Taking #ClimateAction and living more sustainably doesn't have to be difficult.

The #ActNow app helps you reduce your carbon footprint - and have fun doing it. https://t.co/4i2kqgYQPL https://t.co/Ioa1yvId1A

A quality education can transform lives by empowering people and helping overcome poverty, inequality & discrimination. It's also a human right.

On Sunday's #EducationDay, join @UNESCO in calling for greater funding for learning recovery amid #COVID19. https://t.co/aCNXDBfjRV https://t.co/EQ7jdhYcBi

I warmly welcome @POTUS @JoeBiden's steps to re-enter the #ParisAgreement & join the growing coalition of governments, cities, states, businesses & people taking ambitious #ClimateAction. 

-- @antonioguterres on Wednesday. https://t.co/dNVdq8YLbh https://t.co/aLS9mJwzdE

For more than 73 years, @UNPeacekeeping has been helping to create a more peaceful & prosperous world.

More on the work of the men and women #ServingForPeace: https://t.co/1AkYG6N3nb https://t.co/hgUGG7ygvH

Without a nationality, stateless people are often unable to access basic rights and health care. Amid the #COVID19 pandemic, they are at greater risk of being left behind.

None of us are safe until all of us are safe. https://t.co/7l8qiI6Yk6 #iBelong https://t.co/MLwCtka0S0

The worldwide response to #COVID19 has demonstrated the power of solidarity. People are spreading kindness through their words & deeds -- while inspiring others to do the same.

No act of goodwill is too small in the fight against the pandemic.

🎨: Nat Bullard https://t.co/1kqgo1jmRl

Through the Youth Solidarity Fund, @UNAOC provides seed funding and capacity building support to youth-led organizations that foster peaceful and inclusive societies. 

Apply by 31 January: https://t.co/Dg1rMCFzCv

Adaptation to climate change helps protect the world from climate impacts. 

@UNEP explains why adaptation makes economic sense and what we can do to close the #AdaptationGap. #ClimateAction https://t.co/IUDHpO4kk0

#COVID19 has created a global mental health crisis. 

Here are 4 tips for your mental health and ideas on how to help others who may need some extra support and care during the pandemic. 

More from @WHO: https://t.co/kDphI93HrD https://t.co/9aMW4fEwWu

Don’t assume that your bank or your politician cares about this issue as much as you do. They will, the more you raise it with them - and now is the time to raise it.

-- Mark Carney on how everyone has a role to play in taking #ClimateAction. https://t.co/e3piymQHLj https://t.co/rm25mHWiam

.@Refugees has set up new camps in Sudan for the increasing number of people who have fled Ethiopia’s Tigray region.

Additional humanitarian support is urgently needed to meet their needs. https://t.co/3Au8Rq6L76 https://t.co/36Qjj3AAJE

"The elimination of nuclear weapons remains the highest disarmament priority of the United Nations."

-- @antonioguterres as the Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons enters into force Friday. https://t.co/KjC5lbTe68

On Friday, the Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons enters into force - an important step towards the UN's highest disarmament priority: a world free of nuclear weapons. 

Learn about this landmark treaty: https://t.co/673U0CnAWn https://t.co/qANPtrVNeB

.@WorldBank has approved its first #COVID19 vaccine project to help 2+ million people in Lebanon receive the life-saving vaccine. 

The country is grappling with the pandemic amid an economic crisis & the aftermath of Port of Beirut explosion.

https://t.co/N8oX3LiJcd
Colombia: The unanimous & unequivocal support of the Security Council remains essential as peace process continues in the country, says @MisionONUCol. https://t.co/C2FoHasl28

"It is my hope that support to those most vulnerable, respect for human rights & adherence to the principle of leaving no one behind, remain foremost on our minds."

-- @UN_PGA on #COVID19 recovery at #UNGA. https://t.co/VP3wZKuvSW https://t.co/hqgU6VpPno

Amid rising violence following last month's elections in the Central African Republic, head of @UN_CAR appeals to Security Council for more support for @UNPeacekeeping in the country. 
https://t.co/zOaULpXyG6

"Since WHO’s founding in 1948, the US has played a vital role in global health & the American people have made enormous contributions to the health of the world’s people. We look forward to continuing our partnership."

-- @WHO Chief @DrTedros. https://t.co/56eNYQKVH3

I warmly welcome @POTUS Joe Biden’s steps to re-enter the #ParisAgreement & join the growing coalition of governments, cities, states, businesses & people taking ambitious #ClimateAction. 

-- @antonioguterres. https://t.co/dNVdq9gmzR https://t.co/4GH3isd84l

Syria: A decade of conflict, economic collapse, #COVID19 & other challenges have left millions of people grappling with deep trauma and lack of hope, @UNEnvoySyria tells Security Council. https://t.co/nQrbqqZ1ng

The #ParisAgreement is an international treaty which aims to address the climate emergency and to help strengthen resilience.

As we work towards recovery from #COVID19, we must build back greener for our planet & our future. https://t.co/2NtTTL0hq9 https://t.co/tbPiEn7oW4
Mozambique: UN warns of worsening humanitarian crisis in Cabo Delgado province after attacks by armed groups force more than a half million people to flee. https://t.co/UEjya2CgGW

After a shipwreck off the coast of Libya claimed the lives of at least 43 people on Monday, the UN renews call for increased search and rescue operations in the Mediterranean to save lives. https://t.co/RcZWiVOkyd

The #ParisAgreement is an international treaty on the climate emergency, aiming to limit global warming to protect people & planet. 

It offers a meaningful yet flexible framework for all countries to tackle the climate crisis together. https://t.co/lL9hCtcS5q #ClimateAction https://t.co/aUGgVx0NXB

Efforts to control unprecedented desert locust outbreaks in the Horn of Africa protected crops & livelihoods last year.

But, @FAO says more funding needed to continue operations against new incursions.

https://t.co/W0JpztI7S7

We have 10 years to
↩️ reverse the decline in ocean health
💱 transform ocean knowledge to good decisions & innovations
⏩ fast track ocean-based solutions to global issues

More about the #OceanDecade: https://t.co/WFnzu5ylw6 #ForNature via @UNEP https://t.co/dJq6dhCfGI

The pandemic has reversed decades of progress when it comes to women's rights & empowerment.

@UNDP & @UN_Women gender tracker shows only 12% of countries analyzed have #COVID19 response policies in place that address women's recovery needs. https://t.co/tOo3P06Z4z https://t.co/lGPJtVsrHh

Households consume 29% of global energy and contribute to 21% of CO2 emissions. 

Be a #ClimateAction hero - never waste electricity & always turn off the lights you don't need. https://t.co/nAjeCAHlAC #ActNow https://t.co/89YhS4pK9z

The correct way to wear a mask to help stop the spread of #COVID19:
🧴Wash your hands.
😷Put mask over your mouth and nose.
👍Make sure it fits tightly.
✋Don't touch the mask.

Get more Verified information: https://t.co/9cNARG43wd https://t.co/6FGfqdMAQm

Seeking asylum is a fundamental human right for people fleeing violence, persecution, war or disaster at home.

More from @refugees: on the right to seek asylum. https://t.co/rtosk2ky10 https://t.co/MUJWmWxNwx

Since Rashid received his new bee hives from @WFP_Africa, his life has been sweeter. 🐝 🍯

More than 1,700 hives have been distributed in Kenya to strengthen businesses, meet nutritional needs & more. https://t.co/9YaS4xDonr https://t.co/Y6ZX4ZwWyE

When food is wasted, resources that went into producing it are also wasted.

#StopTheWaste by:
🛒 Buying smaller portions
🥬 Buying 'ugly' fruit & vegetables
🌡️ Setting your fridge to the right temperature

More tips from @FAO: https://t.co/C83tWDBYQ5 https://t.co/XrPLcpPWES

"Five winters ago, we were home.
Now, there is no home".

In this powerful poem, @Refugees Goodwill Ambassador @EmiThePoet explains what winter means for those forced to flee, and how you can help them survive. https://t.co/DTW2RdmK07 https://t.co/dDDFMz2tOS

The UN's worldwide response to #COVID19 has shown the value of recent reform efforts, including new, decentralized approaches to solving some of the world's toughest challenges.

Learn more: https://t.co/ym7BwzSQqZ https://t.co/FAfhBkevoT

Libya: @antonioguterres praised breakthrough in deadlock over interim political leadership deal ahead of nationwide elections at end of the year. 

The UN will continue its support for the people of Libya in their efforts to advance peace & stability.
https://t.co/vK0BPn3I6m

From Beirut to Mozambique to Argentina, the UN is supporting the pandemic response and helping communities lay the foundation to recover better from #COVID19. 

See how we're making a difference in our latest @TwitterMoments. https://t.co/SH7L7TVZXL

"Even as vaccines bring hope to some, they become another brick in the wall of inequality between the world’s haves and have-nots.”

-- @WHO chief @DrTedros says more must be done to ensure equitable access to lifesaving #COVID19 vaccine. https://t.co/d1dSbDlieP

"I felt hunger. It was a pain in my stomach that made me cry."

In Yemen, @WFP is helping people like 10-year-old Elaf & her family amid the world's worst humanitarian crisis. https://t.co/tc8gx5tavZ https://t.co/CBd0pzXyGa

The Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons will come into force this week, which represents an encouraging and meaningful commitment towards the UN's highest disarmament priority.

Learn about the importance of this landmark treaty: https://t.co/673U0CnAWn https://t.co/DuWVOU7TkH

We can all stand up against racial prejudice & intolerant attitudes.

Be a human rights champion & #FightRacism on Monday's #MartinLutherKing Day & every day: https://t.co/siDRqxCavU #MLKDay https://t.co/esoHnlfrV5

Millions of people in Latin America have been forced to flee conflict or persecution.

140+ artists from the region have created drawings to reflect on their journeys. More on @Refugees' #RefugiArte initiative: https://t.co/cNYXc6PLJp

https://t.co/MmQ6yGVtPE

Misinformation during a crisis like #COVID19 can result in people being left uninformed, unprotected & vulnerable.

❌ Don't share rumours
✅ Choose content verified by reliable sources
https://t.co/71POIuWBTF

🎨 : Ruth Borrows https://t.co/uCc8zXrFWm

The new @UNEP State of Planet podcast brings together scientists, UN experts, civil society, governments, businesses & others to discuss the world’s most pressing environmental challenges.

Hear about the climate #AdaptationGap in this first episode: https://t.co/9UQuCzJimW

Every year, 8 million deaths are caused by unhealthy diets.

@WHO urges governments to promote healthy food in public places, such as schools & hospitals, to help prevent malnutrition and noncommunicable diseases related to unhealthy diets. https://t.co/RjUFy7E8Eg

🍎🍊🥦 Fruits & vegetables are dietary essentials. 

Ensuring everyone has access to them is crucial in achieving food security & combatting malnutrition. 

2021 is the Int’l Year of Fruits & Vegetables. More from @FAO: https://t.co/Q8jZMHEsX8 #IYFV2021 https://t.co/FMaVkEiquZ

During these times of high-stress and uncertainty amid the #COVID19 pandemic, it's important to look after yourself - and others.

Stay safe and stay positive. We are in this together -- and we will get through this together.

🎨: @aysegulaltinel https://t.co/E8nN7qdxMt

#ActNow to become part of the zero-waste fashion movement:
👕 Buy eco-friendly clothes 
👖 Shop second-hand 
♻️ Upcycle your old clothes

Every #ClimateAction counts.  👉 https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n https://t.co/NgXueHhAPm

2021 is the International Year of Health and Care Workers.

Health heroes have been key in the fight against #COVID19 and are essential to ensure #HealthForAll. We thank them for their hard work & commitment!  

More on the International Year from @WHO. https://t.co/v1wX6jj1Uc https://t.co/ZbR3PDmVgF

Nature can protect us: 

From restoring mangroves to defend against coastal flooding 🌊 

to reforestation to remove greenhouse gases from the atmosphere 🌳

nature-based #ClimateAction is a win-win-win for people 👥, our planet🌍 & our economies 📈. https://t.co/xloASatmuP https://t.co/ov4IihK60B

In an effort to prevent future epidemics, @WHO, @UNICEF and partners have established an Ebola vaccine stockpile to ensure at-risk populations have timely access to life-saving vaccinations. https://t.co/GIMLxKiyzv #VaccinesWork https://t.co/PEPRxFmNtJ

"We have the opportunity to transform our world.
But to achieve this we need global solidarity, just as we need it for a successful recovery from #COVID19."

-- @antonioguterres at #COP26 Roundtable on Clean Power Transition earlier this week. https://t.co/jJ7fCYUKqn

With #COVID19, none of us are safe until all of us are safe.

We must ensure everyone has fair access to a safe & effective vaccine.

Decide #ItsPossible. https://t.co/j4SVI5nQK8 https://t.co/TBmUIfzAvM

📚Learning
🌟Dreaming
🧸Playing
That's what all kids should do.

But millions of girls & boys are trapped in child labour & #COVID19 has deteriorated the situation even further.

2021 is the International Year to #EndChildLabour. https://t.co/EE3f6tvYMQ via @ILO https://t.co/1lSRJ6p5uO

"It's crucial to be able to talk about things like how the #COVID19 virus is affecting the youth in terms of mental health & prejudice."

-- Sophia Chew shares her experience combating social isolation through photography. https://t.co/qg1m34eWKZ via @VoicesOfYouth https://t.co/NDXKMD6sps

2020 was among the 3 hottest years on record.

2011 to 2020 was the warmest decade on record.

More from @WMO on intensifying extreme weather events & impacts of the climate crises: https://t.co/f6t8SjhV7f #ClimateAction https://t.co/tSWNqcxb2e

"Global solidarity will save lives, protect people and help defeat this vicious virus."

As we remember the more than two million people who lost their lives to #COVID19, @antonioguterres urges the world to come together to overcome the pandemic. https://t.co/Hi6vCuilfV https://t.co/XmmNBmoccn

Cultural & creative industries provide nearly 30 million jobs worldwide and employ more people aged 15−29 than any other sector.

2021 is the International Year of Creative Economy for Sustainable Development. https://t.co/kZim4LrX5S #GlobalGoals https://t.co/ZLZnx9cRnR
The UN is providing increased support to Rohingya refugees in Bangladesh after a devastating fire in crowded Cox’s Bazar leaves thousands in need of food and shelter. https://t.co/GnETyl1zt8

"There is no place for child labour in society. It robs children of their future and keeps families in poverty."

-- @ILO chief @GuyRyder as we begin the International Year to #EndChildLabour https://t.co/Jkpl8Mfpa1

"Even though they're refugees, they're still our brothers & sisters."

Staff at local health centres in Jordan are vaccinating refugees, a key step in the fight against the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/TeO52aqYeY via @Refugees 

https://t.co/sC6lCnjEsP

"In the memory of those two million souls, the world must act with far greater solidarity."

-- @antonioguterres on the two millionth death from #COVID19. https://t.co/Hi6vCuilfV https://t.co/ZZFtUVhdNs

There are an estimated 281 million international migrants worldwide. 2/3 of them live in only 20 countries.

Get more migration facts in latest #UNPopulation report from @UNDESA: https://t.co/tT5rQQyA0V https://t.co/HzcRVvAguO

Climate change is a menace to our world. 

Our league of superheroes is taking #ClimateAction and they want YOU to join them! 

Get to know them all and find out how you can #ActNow: https://t.co/nAjeCAHlAC https://t.co/jEEfeBpsxd

Physical distancing during #COVID19 does not have to mean social or emotional isolation.

Stay connected with your family & friends. 

We are in this together & we will get through this together. 

🎨: @JMcNeilStudio https://t.co/CABT7AEJhc

.@UN_Women & @UNVolunteers are seeking women from the global South who are committed to gender equality, women’s empowerment & the UN's mission. 

Apply now for the Young Leaders Programme.  https://t.co/DESPTUvmn5 https://t.co/c6Rn0Ace8b

2020 was one of the hottest years on record, with many extreme weather events and impacts of the climate crises.

"It literally is going to be a death sentence to hundreds of thousands, if not millions, of innocent people in Yemen."

-- @WFPChief & other top UN officials warn of catastrophic famine in Yemen after Houthi movement designated terrorist organization. https://t.co/wMmgTuDEcX

Good health news: Jordan has become one of the world’s first countries to start #COVID19 vaccinations for refugees.

More from @Refugees. https://t.co/V2v18Wr033

From turning on computers, using AI software, to developing an argument, logic is ever-present in our daily lives. 

On Thursday's World #LogicDay, @UNESCO explains how logic plays a key role for sustainable peace and development: https://t.co/XVnaWdGA9O https://t.co/mmJTGVqoGr

Nearly 10 years of conflict & harsh winter conditions pose life-threatening risks to children living in northwest Syria.

@UNICEF is on the ground supporting families with warm clothes, education, healthcare and safe water. https://t.co/bdGfxDnq36 https://t.co/mGahve5Mlu
Mali: On-going political transition could provide country with an opportunity to break out of vicious cycle of crises, head of @UN_MINUSMA tells Security Council. https://t.co/ZpnmvG4O1y

The next 10 years are critical in addressing the climate crisis & saving 1 million species from extinction.

The Decade on Ecosystem Restoration is a rallying call for the protection & revival of ecosystems around the world. 

Join #GenerationRestoration: https://t.co/dErHsl4dk2 https://t.co/PwLdxV3I1w
Central African Republic: @antonioguterres calls for accountability after attacks outside capital Bangui resulted in death of a UN Peacekeeper with @UN_CAR. https://t.co/XJVDLXKtbR

As #COVID19 threatens lives & livelihoods, the #GlobalGoals can lead the way to a sustainable recovery and a better future for all.

From taking #ClimateAction to speaking out against injustices, we all have a role to play in transforming our world. https://t.co/CXww0NkkOp https://t.co/IYf8n5Ie4D

Many people working from home due to #COVID19 are facing a range of challenges -- including poor working conditions, inadequate wages & increased health risks.

Those in least developed countries particularly at risk, warns @ILO. https://t.co/IB1XV6eW03
